results.title: The Great toy robbery
results.creator_credit: Jeffrey Hale, Robert Verrall, Tom Daly, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated spoof of the wild west movies starring the world’s most wanted good guy, Santa Claus, and three hard riding, gun-toting, bad guys. As in all formula westerns, good guys win over evil, but not before robbers and robbed have romped through some incongruous, though recognizable situations. (Awards include: New York, Belgrade)

results.title: Alexander the Great and the Battle of Issus
results.creator_credit: Phil Grabsky and Seventh Art Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Great commanders”.
Alexander the Great had conquered all of the then known world by the time of his death at 32. At the Battle of Issus, he led a charge across a river to crush a massive Persian force. Alexander’s military genius allowed him to employ daring strategems and from his victory at Issus, he went on to become one of the greatest commanders of all time.

results.title: Napoleon Bonaparte and the Battle of Austerlitz
results.creator_credit: Phil Grabsky and Seventh Art Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Great commanders”.
Napoleon remains one of the most enigmatic and skillful military leaders the world has ever seen. Exploiting the turmoil of the French Revolution, Napoleon was able to eventually become Emperor of France and then set his sights towards the rest of Europe. At the Battle of Austerlitz, Napoleon was able to command a victory against Austria and Russia.

results.title: Horatio Nelson and the Battle of Trafalgar
results.creator_credit: Phil Grabsky and Seventh Art Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Great commanders”.
Nelson is considered Britain’s greatest naval hero. Throughout his early career, he was considered insuboridinate and reckless, but the genius of his miltitary leadership ensured him a place in history. His battles against rival European fleets were unparalleled successes. At the Battle of Trafalgar, Nelson ensured that Britain had mastery of the seas which brought about the subsequent expansion of the British Empire.

results.title: The Great commanders
results.creator_credit: Phil Grabsky and Seventh Art Productions
results.brief_description: A six part series which looks at six individuals considered to be military giants. Their motivation and the qualities which made them great commanders are analysed by experts. 3D computer animation is used to illustrate each commander’s particular skill in battle. Each program takes as its focus a key battle which examines the nature of each individual’s military command.
